events.originalText: General Abdel Fattah el-Sisi led a coalition to depose President Mohamed Morsi in a coup d'état in Cairo, suspending the Egyptian Constitution of 2012.
events.subtitle: Abdel Fattah el-Sisi
events.headline: General Abdel Fattah el-Sisi leads coalition to depose President Mohamed Morsi in Cairo coup

events.originalText: Same-sex marriage became legal in Spain with the coming into effect of a law passed by the Cortes Generales.
events.subtitle: Same-sex marriage
events.headline: Spain legalizes same-sex marriage with new law

events.originalText: U.S. president Jimmy Carter signed a presidential finding, authorizing the CIA to secretly aid the mujahideen in their fight against the Soviet-backed Democratic Republic of Afghanistan.
events.subtitle: Jimmy Carter
events.headline: Jimmy Carter authorizes CIA to aid mujahideen in Afghanistan fight

events.originalText: British singer David Bowie retired his stage persona Ziggy Stardust in a surprise announcement on the last day of a 17-month tour.
events.subtitle: David Bowie
events.headline: David Bowie retires Ziggy Stardust persona after 17-month tour

events.originalText: The Troubles: The British Army began the Falls Curfew in Belfast, Northern Ireland, which resulted in greater Irish republican resistance.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: British Army initiates Falls Curfew in Belfast during The Troubles

events.originalText: Dan-Air Flight 1903 crashed into the slopes of the Montseny Massif in Catalonia, Spain, killing all 112 people aboard.
events.subtitle: Dan-Air Flight 1903
events.headline: Dan-Air Flight 1903 crashes in Catalonia, Spain, killing all 112 aboard

events.originalText: SS United States (pictured) departed New York Harbor on her maiden voyage, on which completion she became the fastest ocean liner to cross the Atlantic.
events.subtitle: SS United States
events.headline: SS United States sets record on maiden voyage across Atlantic

events.originalText: Second World War: The Royal Navy attacked the French fleet at Mers El Kébir, fearing that the ships would fall into Axis hands after the French–German armistice.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Royal Navy attacks French fleet at Mers El Kébir during Second World War

events.originalText: On the 75th anniversary of the end of the Battle of Gettysburg, U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt dedicated the Eternal Light Peace Memorial.
events.subtitle: 1938 Gettysburg reunion
events.headline: President Roosevelt dedicates Eternal Light Peace Memorial at Gettysburg anniversary

events.originalText: Confederate forces were defeated by the Union Army on the last day of the Battle of Gettysburg (pictured), a turning point in the American Civil War.
events.subtitle: Confederate States Army
events.headline: Union Army defeats Confederate forces at Battle of Gettysburg

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Loyalists and Iroquois killed over 300 Patriots at the Battle of Wyoming in Pennsylvania.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Loyalists and Iroquois kill over 300 Patriots at Battle of Wyoming

events.originalText: French and Indian War: George Washington surrendered Fort Necessity in Pennsylvania, the only military surrender in his career.
events.subtitle: French and Indian War
events.headline: George Washington surrenders Fort Necessity in only military surrender of his career

events.originalText: Civil wars of the Tetrarchy: Roman emperor Constantine the Great defeated his former colleague Licinius at the Battle of Adrianople.
events.subtitle: Civil wars of the Tetrarchy
events.headline: Constantine the Great defeats Licinius at Battle of Adrianople in Tetrarchy civil wars
